text:
Appearance:
Cloudy orange under an off-white creamy head which lingers long like a velveteen blanket. Swirls with extremely sticky lace which lingers from first quaff to last. Lovely lacing.

Nose:
Sour/tart tropical fruits. Apricots, cantaloupe, starfruit, and guava. Really sour sourdough bread. Grains of paradise and caraway. Prickly pear and agave. Splintered bark and golden leather soft to the touch. Grapefruit and lemon rind in the back and along the edge. Candied ginger.

Palate:
Zing! Zow! Grabs my tastebuds and doesnt let gonot that I want it to. Sour tart not-quite-ripe tropical fruits such as starfruit, papaya, guava, and a touch of agave. Candied ginger and spice in the breath. Loaves of freshly baked sourdough. Far more herbs than the nose implied: juniper, flower stems, grains of paradise, and caraway. Citrus rind and rustic oaky finish.

Final Thoughts:
Fabulous doesnt come close to describing this offering from Cigar City Brewing. While on draft, I quaffed many pints before it was unfortunately retired from their brewing cycle. But maybe just maybe, Cigar City will bring this beer back if I say please with a cherry on top. Please.

(An original written work by Beer Ambassador, LLC. Plagiarism is not tolerated.)

On tap at Broken Barrel, old rating.  Hazy orange with a thick, white head.  Strong aroma of pine and fruit, perhaps an apricot?  Lots of carbonation.  Bready tastes with spice and fruit bitterness on the finish.  7/12

On tap at Churchkey (Wash. DC).  Poured a hazy golden orange color with a small white head.  Mildly hoppy aroma with some roasted malts in the background.  Taste has a funkiness up front with hay and lemon, along with some grainy maltiness. Then a herbal hop bitterness and some alcoholic burn and slight oakiness to round out the finish. Medium body with a good amount of carbonation.

On tap at the brewery. Fruity and floral nose, with some Brett notes. Hazy with a 2-cm creamy head. Big fruit initial -- watermelon rind, spices. Some great bittering in mid. Finish is tart, sourish, and bitter. Smooth, juicy, and prickly. Like a Belgian Pale Ale with a lot of fresh-squeezed fruit. Love it.

on tap-pours brown with a tan head.  Aroma is roasty/cocoa-medium malt.  Taste is roasty/cocoa-medium malt, earthy/spice hops.  Apparently as mis labeled keg, would like to know which this was and get some Jean Ribault still.  3.5

7/28/12. On tap at Kickbacks. Slightly hazy amber pour, almost orange, with a nice khaki head that sticks around forever and laces in nice foamy rings. Spicy yeast in the aroma with plenty of phenolics, nice floral aspects, malt, and a hint of tartness. Nice flavor with lots of phenolic bitterness, spicy yeast, floral aspects, pale malts, tropical fruits, a hint of tartness, and lingering orange and lemon. Nice!

On tap at Coffee District - as the original reviewer explained, this beer defies categorization

A: Cloudy orange with a frothy head. Good retention and sticky foam

S: Wow, super fruity nose (apple juice, grapefruit, guava)...This tastes ALOT like Guava Grove batch one. Never had a beer hopped with these hops, but it lends a juicy ripe fruit aroma. Complex and balanced

T: Guava, apples, white grapes, and almost a Chardonnay characteristic. Very similar to Guava Grove somehow.

MF/O: Smooth carbonation, tangy tart guava finish. Delicious beer, glad to try another winner from CCB

On tap at Churchkey.  Served in a mini snifter.  Pours clear golden with a nice, foamy white head.  A bit of lacing and a thin cap.  The nose has some nice peppery phenolics along with some light earthy hops.  A bit of pilsner base comes underneath.  Flavor hits the same notes with the yeast being most prominent.  Good spicy, earthy character.  Light-medium body with smooth bitterness.  Pretty good.

Draft.  Large off-white head atop cloudy apple cider body.  Aroma is medium sweet, straw, some spicy, light kiwi, strawberry.  Taste is medium sweet, spicy, straw, bread, strawberry, cantaloupe.  Soft light-medium body.
On tap at Churckey for the Funky Buddha and CCB event. Peppery spice ane phenolics with hints of bandaid and earth. Medium body with low carbonation.

On draft @ the independent Seminole Heights.  Great overall aroma and appearance.  Smells of white grape and citrus.  Thin cream color head that had great retention.  Light copper/ hazy orange color.  Taste of white grape citrus fruit,  slightly bitter.  Nelson Sauvin hops really get a chance to shine in conjunction with the bier de garde yeast.   Overall good easy drinking beer.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Woodys. Pours a glowing orange, hazy, huge head and awesome lacing. Aromas of bread, peach, fresh hops. Taste is a nice fruitiness, cherrys, sugar, peach, hops. Not bad, had a nice sessionable fruity character.
Tap at Rattle N Hum.  Cloudy yellow orange.  Big fruit aroma: Orange, Apricot, Mango.  Some pine, but mostly its sour fresh fruit.  Some cloves as well.  Really interesting beer.
On tap at rattle.  Pour is thick hazy orange, with white soapy head.  Sweet apricot, peach,  and pine flavor.  Aroma is incredibly floral and fruity.  Fresh and robust.. Nice pale!
Tap at the brewery. Dark gold pour with a thick white head. Sweet malt, oranges and touch of earthy hops in the aroma. Smooth malty taste with notes of orange. Tasty brew.

Tap at CCB. Huge complete massive lace atop low haze orange. Really nice melon rind nose with flowers and spice. Very rich flower and nectar. Taste is oily up front and dry in the end. Some Nelson type hops perhaps or squashy oddities. Toasted nut finish. Strange. I liked it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft at the source. Hazy yellor color, thick white head, solid lacing. Aroma of subtle hay. Taste is floral grass and citrus. Decent.

Pours a golden amber with a paperthin head, leaving a nice lacing behind. Aroma of grassy earth, Nelson hops and pepper. Taste follows. Great different beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft at cigar city with Linh. Pours a hazy amber body with white lacing. Aroma is dried apricot and pine. Mouthfeel is dry with notes of fruit hops, apricot, pine needles and sour peach. Great pale.

On draft at Cigar City.  Pours a clear yellow with a white head.  Nose is citrus, caramel, lemon peel, and miscellaneous citrus, with hints of light malt.  Flavor is similar with light citrus, lemon peel, and orange rind all wrapped together in a dry finish.  Light to medium in body and interesting pale overall.

Draft Mostly clear orange ale with a huge, frothy, white head. Great retention. The nose is a spicy, fruity, earthy mélange of citrusy, peppery and floral hops; biscuit and bready malts; fuzzy-fruity, spicy, brothy esters and phenols. Medium to full-bodied with a mildly creamy mouthfeel and vibrant carbonation. The flavor serves up a lot of nice, earthy, peppery, tropical bitterness intertwined with spicy, bready, Belgian yeast inspired notes. Finishes moderately bitter, lightly abrasive and then dries out a good bit. Interesting. Totally worth trying.

On tap at CCB. Pours a hazy orange with light head. Smells of floral and citrus. Taste of fresh hops giving a slight bitter finish. Great body for only 6%abv. Nice sticky lacing. Not really a session beer but I could go for another, then another...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On draft at CCB, poured a murky orange color with aromas of orange peel, lemon zest, grapefruit, and floral notes.  Flavors are citrus, grapefruit,hops, not too much bitterness, buta t ouch of tartness comes through.

What a beer to sip upon! The body was a great hazy orange with very light bubbles. Lots of grapefruit, orange peel and hops are in the nose - altogether pretty floral. The first sip gives off an intense hop fruitiness, but that mellows out with a solid sweet-malt twang. Finishes clean and dry - VERY drinkable all damn day.

Draft at CCB. Nose is plenty of orange, well water, more citrus, and fresh hops. Fruity and hoppy. Pour is an orange color with a haze similar to grapefruit juice. Taste is burnt caramel, orange peel, and more citrus. Very fruity taste with a good amount of bitters on the finish. Not bad at all. Very sessionable.
Draft from Cigar City.  Complex citrus aroma.  Light orange color.  Medium sour taste.  Medium to light body with bitter aftertaste.  Overall a very good beer.
